full_text: As I close this chapter in the U.S. Senate, I wish every Utahn the very best in their years ahead. I’m confident that the future is bright, and that our state will continue to grow and thrive. It’s been a profound honor to serve you—thank you for giving me the opportunity. https://t.co/czbgadRFBy
While I support keeping government open, I voted no on the CR—a simple protest of the absurd way this is to run government.

This is great news! Strengthening U.S. manufacturing capabilities will help break our dependence on China for microchips. Today’s announcement of funding for @TXInstruments semiconductor fab in Lehi means Utah will continue to play a vital role in bolstering national security.

We've turned our framework to mitigate extreme AI risks—such as nuclear and cyber threats—into bipartisan legislation. This should be the starting point for discussion on actions Washington should take on AI-enabled risks that don’t stifle U.S. innovation.https://t.co/uSkWW8UYWk

While AI could dramatically improve our lives, it also poses enormous national security risks. Our bipartisan legislation would preserve America’s competitive edge while safeguarding our advanced technology from those looking to cause widespread harm. https://t.co/uSkWW8UYWk

This year’s NDAA contains several measures which will support Utah's role in our national defense, including strengthening the Sentinel program at @HAFB and addressing our military recruitment crisis—a top priority of the @UTNationalGuard. https://t.co/VHNvF2pM6u

Around the world, authoritarianism is on the rise and freedom is in retreat. America's involvement in global affairs helps promote stability and support freedom, which is in our own interest. By maintaining strategic relationships and championing freedom, we put America first. https://t.co/N6067d8xrk

America is blessed because it is good. We’ve welcomed the poor and hungry and championed freedom for people here and around the world. It’s incumbent on all of us to maintain this tradition of goodness. If we do, America’s future will continue to be bright. https://t.co/E8u9HCx7Zv

Looking forward, it’s incumbent upon Washington to find consensus on the issues that, while not necessarily front and center in people’s minds, would cause calamity down the road without action—like the national debt, China’s emergence as the global power, AI, and climate. https://t.co/UGnjo4za1e

The American people expect us to work together to address our country's most pressing challenges. While in the Senate, I was fortunate to work with a bipartisan group of senators in crafting and passing major pieces of legislation that made a difference for Utah and the nation. https://t.co/I5KZKeSd3x

Faith and family have been the foundation of my 25 years in public service. Tune in to hear my conversation with @JakeTapper about what I’ve learned and the challenges we must confront as a nation.

I’m deeply grateful for the opportunity I’ve had to serve Utah and the nation in the United States Senate. Tune in tomorrow morning at 7 a.m. MT, 9 a.m ET for my interview with @JakeTapper on @CNNSOTU:

After a long wait, Dr. Martha Hughes Cannon is officially part of the @USCapitol collection! Utah will be well represented by this trailblazing suffragist who was the first woman ever to be elected as a state senator in the United States. Thanks to all who made this possible. https://t.co/4l022UXBWH

I'm pleased to see our legislation, which makes it easier for well-intentioned organizations to clean up and improve water quality at abandoned mines, pass both the House and Senate! It now heads to the President's desk to be signed into law.

Throughout my 25 years of public service, I have learned that politics alone cannot measure up to the challenges we face. A country’s character is a reflection not just of its elected officials but also of its people. May we each be a voice of unity and virtue. https://t.co/bOWTdmTqff
I will soon deliver my farewell address from the Senate floor. It has been a profound honor to serve Utah and the nation. Tune in here: https://t.co/MWpczii2JH

While we’ve faced many challenges over the last six years of my Senate term, we’ve also been able to accomplish important things for Utah and our country. Here’s our report detailing the policy and constituent service highlights from my term: https://t.co/cFKCL2o6jV
